chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K Kern was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNT TWO AND THREE, EACH COUNT:  Consecutive to each other and with any other time.  Huber release to the Day Reporting Center for programming.  No electronic monitoring as to either count.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees and assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain employment to the extent allowable by Social Security Administration as to not affect payments.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain mental health assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  If prescribed, take any prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.

No illegal drugs or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victims Johnathon T., Heather S., Lekemberell M.
The Court grants expungement only if the defendant successfully completes each and every term/condition of probation during the probation period.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in cognitive thinking service.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screns and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: as stated in count two.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant Michael K Kern not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court REMANDS defendant.  Matter scheduled for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Telephone call to Attorney Lisa Procaccio.  Matter scheduled for Return on Warrant on December 15, 2015 @ 8:30 a.m.
No reply from defendant

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Michael K Kern not in court.  Benjamin A. Wesson for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing on today at 1:30 p.m.  Attorney Lisa Procaccio appeared prior to case being called on the record awaiting the arrival of the defendant.  Case called at approximately 4:12 p.m.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Justice Point Discharge Summary, received and filed.
*court to address on 10-7-14*
VIOLATION REPORT (missed office contact), received and filed.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter scheduled for Sentencing hearing.  Parties advised that due to time constraints (congested calendar) the court is unable to hear this matter on today.  New date selected with the parties.  The Court reviews the Justice Point report with the parties.  Defendant admonished by the court as to compliance with bail conditions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNTS 2(AS AMENDED) AND 3:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court with attorney Lisa Marie Procaccio.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Amended Information filed changing COUNT 2:  CRIMINAL DAMAGE TO PROPERTY contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 943.01(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  On motion of the State, Court orally added PARTY TO A CRIME contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 939.05.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court with attorney Lisa M Procaccio.  Defendant Michael K Kern in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Arraignment hearing.   Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant as to all counts.  Parties have reached global resolution; the court accepts transfer of case 13CM1513.  Misdemeanor case to be returned to Branch 46 if not resolved on the next date.  Defendant discharged by JusticePoint.  The Court orders tot JusticePoint in this case in the event the defendant posts bail on the misdemeanor.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Discharge Summary report, received and filed.
*due to in-custody status*

Defendant Michael K Kern in court with attorney Lisa M Schlieben.  Defendant Michael K Kern in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ronald Villagomez-MPD Officer.  Per the request of the Defendant, he was taken out of Court.  Defense motion to adjourn the hearing was denied by the Court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/6/14.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Michael K Kern in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant pled not guilty to misdemeanor count 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
